text.headline: Electronic invoices timeline
text.text:
A timeline of how electronic invoicing is introduced in Europe, particularly Germany/ZUGFeRD. JSON file for the great MPL Knightlabs Timeline.
v1.0 2018-06-09 by Jochen Stärk, Mustangproject.org

License: Public domain. Feel free to send pull requests. We're e.g. looking for ZUGFeRD Roadshow dates and FNFE cooperation events.

text.headline: EDI-Standards in Germany
text.text: Andreas Pelekies mentioned on the fourth annual FeRD conference in 2018 that the first EDI standards in Germany evolved in 1977 (https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Pelekies_Aktueller_Stand_von_ZUGFeRD_2.0_4._FeRD.pdf)

text.headline: ebXML
text.text: UN/CEFACT publishes https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EbXML, the predecessor of UBL

text.headline: UBL 1.0
text.text: OASIS publishes UBL, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Business_Language

text.headline: Denmark
text.text: Denmark makes electronic B2G invoices (in a UBL based standard called OIOUBL) obligatory and saves 100 mio € per year (https://www.batch.co.uk/web/images/PDFs/EU-report.pdf)

text.headline: UBL 2.0
text.text: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Business_Language 2.0 is released

text.headline: Sweden
text.text: Sweden follows Denmark in mandatorizing eInvoices for central government agencies

text.headline: European legislative process
text.text: European legislation advances from a report of the Expert Group on e-Invoicing (https://www.batch.co.uk/web/images/PDFs/EU-report.pdf) to the Directive 2014/55/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX%3A32014L0055

text.headline: Spain
text.text: Mandatory for Public administration suppliers (invoices higher than EUR 5 000)

text.headline: Finland
text.text: eInvoicing is mandatory through the Finnish Government Programme since 2010

text.headline: FeRD founded
text.text: The Forum elektronische Rechnung Deutschland (FeRD) is founded

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0RC
text.text: In the context of the Cebit fair the 1.0 specification release candidate of ZUGFeRD is released in german language

text.headline: UBL 2.1
text.text: UBL 2.1, the later ISO standard, is released

text.headline: Austria
text.text: B2G e-invoicing becomes mandatory in Austria

text.headline: Italy
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since 2014 (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+Italy)

text.headline: Konik 0.1.0
text.text: First release of the Konik open-source Java ZUGFeRD library

text.headline: Mustangproject
text.text: First release of the open-source Java ZUGFeRD library Mustangproject

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 1.0
text.text: Release of final ZUGFeRD 1.0 specification (in german)

text.headline: Article in the german iX Magazine 8/14
text.text: Vadim Bauer from Konik writes https://www.heise.de/ix/heft/Fakturierungsautomat-2268413.html

text.headline: 1st annual FeRD conference
text.text: The FeRD meets at the Ministry of Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy in Berlin

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0.1 specification
text.text: more precisely: Corrigendum to 1.0

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.1
text.text: Mustangproject 1.1 is released

text.headline: Slovenia
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory in Slovenia since 2015

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0 specification (in english)
text.text: Previously it was available only in german

text.headline: 1st developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the first ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: 2nd developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the second ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: Official Launch of zugferd-community.net
text.text: The FeRDMC launches the website among others for ZUGFeRD developer days participants

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.2
text.text: The open-source Java ZUGFeRD library Mustangproject releases Version 1.2

text.headline: 3rd developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the third ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: UBL becomes ISO Standard
text.text: UBL 2.1 becomes ISO/IEC 19845:2015

text.headline: ZUGFeRD/Mustangproject is awarded the OSBAR
text.text: Mustangproject is awarded the first prize (award in gold) of the Open Source Business Association at the Open! conference in Stuttgart

text.headline: 160 supporters
text.text: The list of supporters counts 160 supporters from 7 countries

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.3
text.text: Mustangpproject releases version 1.3

text.headline: 199 supporters
text.text: http://www.ferd-net.de/zugferd/unterstuetzerliste/index.html counts 199 supporters

text.headline: 4th developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the fourth ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: 3rd annual FeRD conference in Berlin
text.text: The FeRD meets at the Ministry of Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy in Berlin

text.headline: France
text.text:
Gradual introduction of electronic invoicing,
  • 01/01/2017 for any company including more than 5000 employees
  • 01/01/2018 for any company including 250 to 5000 employees
  • 01/01/2019 for any company including 10 to 250 employees
  • 01/01/2020 for any company including less than 10 employees

text.headline: Netherlands
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since January 2017 for central government agencies and voluntary for sub-central government. (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+The+Netherlands)

text.headline: Official launch of the ZUGFeRD User Group
text.text: FeRDMC(?) launches a committee to be able to adapt to the electronic invoicing requirements of different industry sectors

text.headline: Estonia
text.text: Electronic invoices become mandatory for the whole public sector

text.headline: Amendment to the german e-invoing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung)
text.text: The amendment is published in Germany's official journal Bundesgesetzblatt 19/2017 https://www.bgbl.de/xaver/bgbl/start.xav?startbk=Bundesanzeiger_BGBl#__bgbl__%2F%2F*%5B%40attr_id%3D%27bgbl117s0770.pdf%27%5D__1516912634862

text.headline: Release of XRechnung 1.0 (Specification)
text.text: XRechnung, the german national dialect, i.e. a EN16931 CIUS, is published https://www.xoev.de/die_standards/xrechnung/xrechnung_versionen/xrechnung_version_1_0-14771

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.4
text.text: The open source java ZUGFeRD library is releases Version 1.4

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X Beta 1
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes ZUGFeRD as Factur-X

text.headline: Lithuania
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since 1 July 2017 (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+Lithuania)

text.headline: 1st release of factur-x
text.text: The open-source Python library for ZUGFeRD/Factur-X is released http://www.akretion.com/blog/akretion-publishes-opensource-factur-x-python-lib

text.headline: Public review of ZUGFeRD 2.0,Part 1 (EN16931)
text.text: A ZUGFeRD 2.0 draft is released as public preview version http://www.ferd-net.de/aktuelles/meldungen/kommentierung-zugferd-2.0.html

text.headline: German e-invoing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung)
text.text: (https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Downloads/DE/Gesetzestexte/e-rechnungs-verordnung.pdf)

text.headline: Adoption of EN16931 profile of Public review of ZUGFeRD 2.0,Part 1
text.text: The public preview gets adopted but is not yet officially published

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X Beta 2
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes the second beta of ZUGFeRD/Factur-X

text.headline: Change E-Rechnungsverordnung act Bundesgesetzblatt 68/2017
text.text: Amendment to the e-invoicing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung) is published in Germany's official journal Bundesgesetzblatt 68/2017

text.headline: German E-Rechnungsverordnung Phase 1
text.text: electronic invoices to be accepted by german authorities

text.headline: 308 officially listed ZUGFeRD supporters
text.text: http://www.ferd-net.de/zugferd/unterstuetzerliste/index.html

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.5
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 1.5

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X 1.0
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes the final version of a ZUGFeRD 2.0 subset = Factur-X 1.0

text.headline: 4th annual FeRD conference in Berlin
text.text: See slides and footage

text.headline: European transition period for central govermental bodies
text.text: according to https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Hauschild_Europische_Richtlinie_zur_elektronischen_Rechnungsstellung_bei_ffentlichen_Auftrgen_4._FeRD_Konferenz.pdf

text.headline: Transition period for subcentral govermental bodies
text.text: according to https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Hauschild_Europische_Richtlinie_zur_elektronischen_Rechnungsstellung_bei_ffentlichen_Auftrgen_4._FeRD_Konferenz.pdf

text.headline: Belgium
text.text: E-invoices mandatory on federal level for B2G invoices exceeding 135000€

text.headline: Mustangproject published the 2nd article in the german iX Magazine 4/18
text.text: B2G, B2B and B2C aspects of ZUGFeRD 2.0 and XRechnung

text.headline: 6th ZUGFeRD Developer Days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the sixth ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: New online validator
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ becomes available in version 0.4.4 as http://validator.zugferd.org

text.headline: Germany: B2G e-invoices now mandatory
text.text: E-Rechnungsverordnung Phase 2: paper and non-hybrid PDF invoices to be rejected by german authorities
